post_content:
By Cohen Coberly on March 28, 2019
Verizon takes steps to combat spam calls
Click to expand...

Verizon will automatically opt Android customers into its anti-robocall app
August 27, 2019
https://www.engadget.com/2019/08/27...ically-opt-android-customers-into-its-anti-r/
Now, if you're on Android, you'll get it as standard, so you don't need to do anything to avoid the nuisance.

From today, the company will auto-enroll eligible Android users to its Call Filter service. This will block high-risk calls outright, sending them to voicemail, and display calls from known spam as "Potential Spam" on their caller ID. You'll have the option to turn on blocking for these types of calls, as well as calls from overseas.
At the moment, iOS users will still have to manually download the Call Filter app, as will pay-as-you-go Android customers [...]
Click to expand...

Available on select Android handsets at first
Click to expand...
Verizon to enable spam call filtering by default on select Android phones by Jon Porter.​

Verizon free Call Filter app automatically silences spam calls in iOS 14
JUly 23, 2020
https://appleinsider.com/articles/2...p-automatically-silences-spam-calls-in-ios-14
Verizon has announced it is partnering with Apple to fight the onslaught of robocalls plaguing users, starting with the release of iOS 14.

With iOS 14, Verizon's Call Filter app will be offering additional features currently not available. This new feature — dubbed Silence Junk Callers — will automatically recognize calls identified by the Verizon network as potential spam or fraud and then send them directly to voicemail without ringing your phone.
While the feature will roll out in earnest this fall when iOS 14 is fully released, iOS 14 beta users who subscribe to the "plus" version of Verizon's Call Filter app will be eligible starting today to use the feature.
Click to expand...
Both the free and "plus" versions of the app include spam detection and a spam filter. The paid version includes caller ID, spam lookup, a personal block list, and a spam risk meter.
When iOS 14 launches it will be available to the free users of Call Filter as well. Call Filter Plus is $2.99 a month for one line or $7.99 for multiple lines per account.
Click to expand...
